Have you seen the new public art installation that is stationed next to NYOS Charter School's Lamar Campus? Entitled "Without Trial," 50 volunteers including NYOS alumni and NYOS parents recently created a meaningful work of art which they began building on Juneteenth.

The art installation consists of numerous colorful flags which come together to form a raised fist. Each flag provides the name of a Black individual who has been killed since 2013, along with additional details, and each flag is also color-coded to represent individuals such as victims who were unarmed, part of a pending investigation, transgender, or below or above a certain age.

To learn more about the work of art, our NYOS community can visit the art installation in between W Yager Ln and our Lamar Campus along with viewing more information on the companion website here: http://data-irl.com/. We're continuously proud of our NYOS community and the work that they're doing to participate in acts of civic engagement that display their integrity and their respect and dignity for all.

We know that at-home learning can lead to many logistical changes for NYOS Charter School students, including how they receive grades.

Because of this, spring semester report card grades for all NYOS Secondary students (6th-12th grade) will appear as either a “P” or “I.” A grade of “P” indicates that the student has demonstrated proficiency and is therefore awarded the credit for the spring semester of the course. A grade of “I” denotes that the grade is incomplete. A student cannot earn credit for any course with a grade of an “I.” Teachers will use 3rd quarter grades and completed At-Home Learning activities to assign a “P” or an “I.”

To learn more details regarding Secondary grades, how spring semester GPAs will be calculated, expectations for spring semester final exams, and more, please read the new helpful FAQ found here: https://www.nyos.org/apps/pages/secondarygradingfaq

Beginning this week, and in the upcoming weeks, Boys & Girls Clubs of the Austin Area will be providing the NYOS community with an on-site camp for students whose parents work in essential services and who are need of childcare.

The camp will be offered on weekdays from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM and is $20 per student, per day for students in K-8th. Up to 30 students can be registered for this camp, and students will be separated into groups of 9 children per room with 1 adult staff member per room. Additionally, throughout the camp, Boys & Girls Clubs will be following strict safety and health guidelines to keep our community safe. Go here to learn more and to register your student for the camp: https://www.nyos.org/apps/news/article/1205314

- 4th & 5th Grade Literature Library: $500.00
- Elementary Student Led Orchestra: $1,145.00
- "Learning for All" Elementary SPED Resources: $271.01
- Creative Action 1st Grade Programming: $1,600.00
- Creative Action 4th Grade Programming: $1,600.00
- Secondary Theatre Resources: $600.00
- TAFE Competition Fees: $4,000.00

The PTA's community programs will also fund two NYOS reading programs, an Elementary summer reading program and a middle school reading program, for a total of $1,676!
